meanings.definition: Relating to the process of abstracting or removing something from a particular context.
meanings.sent1: The abstractive concept helped us focus on the main idea.
meanings.sent2: Her abstractive thinking made it easier to understand complex topics.
meanings.sent3: The abstractive approach to problem-solving was surprisingly effective.
meanings.sent4: His abstractive mind could see connections others missed.
meanings.sent5: The abstractive nature of the theory made it hard to grasp at first.

meanings.sent1: The abstractive nature of the statement made it hard to apply to real situations.
meanings.sent2: She had an abstractive way of looking at the world.
meanings.sent3: His abstractive tendencies sometimes led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The abstractive language used in the article confused many readers.
meanings.sent5: The abstractive approach to art left room for interpretation.
